New Records: Rohit Sharma reached 200 sixes in T20Is
Rohit Sharma's fastest fifty in all T20s (19 balls)
India's fastest hundred in T20 World Cups (8.4 overs)
Rohit Sharma hit the most sixes by an Indian in an innings in the T20 World Cup (8 sixes)
Key Match Events: Travis Head hit a walk-off grand slam in the ninth inning
Maxwell was deceived by the googly and got out to Axar Patel
Marcus Stoinis was caught on the reverse sweep
David Warner fell to Arshdeep Singh
Rohit Sharma scored 92 off 41 balls, including 50 off 19 balls
Pre-Game Insights: Australia left out a spinner for a fast bowler in the powerplay
Rohit Sharma wanted to field instead of bowl
Conditions were sticky, with potential for swing due to cross-winds
India's team is a little different, with most of their firepower in the middle order
Post-Match Reflections: Australia will have to make perfect use of the powerplay if they are to stand a chance of getting to this target
Travis Head took the Rohit catch in the ODI World Cup final, while Tim David took the Virat Kohli catch
Miscellaneous Highlights: Weather was cooler with potential for swing in the air
Pitch conditions similar to the England vs South Africa game where 163 was defended
Others: Rohit Sharma's last 14 balls included five sixes and three fours
Mitchell Starc's most expensive over in any format of cricket (29 runs)
